verses.text_plain: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.verse_html:
1So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes. ▼
▼ to…: Heb. from answering

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to…: Heb. from answering

verses.text_plain: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
verses.verse_html:
2Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God. ▼
▼ himself: Heb. his soul

footnotes.body_html: ▼ himself: Heb. his soul

verses.text_plain: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
verses.verse_html: 3Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

verses.text_plain: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
verses.verse_html:
4Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he. ▼
▼ waited…: Heb. expected Job in words
 , ▼
▼ elder: Heb. elder for days

footnotes.body_text: ▼ waited…: Heb. expected Job in words
footnotes.body_html: ▼ waited…: Heb. expected Job in words
▼ elder: Heb. elder for days

verses.text_plain: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
verses.verse_html: 5When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

verses.text_plain: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
verses.verse_html:
6And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion. ▼
▼ young: Heb. few of days
 , ▼
▼ durst…: Heb. feared

footnotes.body_html: ▼ young: Heb. few of days

verses.text_plain: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
verses.verse_html: 7I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

verses.text_plain: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
verses.verse_html: 8But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

verses.text_plain: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
verses.verse_html: 9Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

verses.text_plain: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
verses.verse_html: 10Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

tokens.text: to me; I also will shew

verses.text_plain: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
verses.verse_html:
11Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say. ▼
▼ reasons: Heb. understandings
 , ▼
▼ what…: Heb. words

verses.text_plain: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
verses.verse_html: 12Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

verses.text_plain: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
verses.verse_html: 13Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

verses.text_plain: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
verses.verse_html:
14Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches. ▼
▼ directed: or, ordered

tokens.text: against me: neither will I answer

verses.text_plain: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
verses.verse_html:
15They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking. ▼
▼ left…: Heb. removed speeches from themselves

footnotes.body_text: ▼ left…: Heb. removed speeches from themselves
footnotes.body_html: ▼ left…: Heb. removed speeches from themselves

verses.text_plain: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
verses.verse_html: 16When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

verses.text_plain: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
verses.verse_html: 17I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

verses.text_plain: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
verses.verse_html:
18For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me. ▼
▼ matter: Heb. words
 , ▼
▼ spirit…: Heb. spirit of my belly

footnotes.body_text: ▼ spirit…: Heb. spirit of my belly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ spirit…: Heb. spirit of my belly

verses.text_plain: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
verses.verse_html:
19Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles. ▼
▼ hath…: Heb. is not opened

footnotes.body_html: ▼ hath…: Heb. is not opened

verses.text_plain: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
verses.verse_html:
20I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer. ▼
▼ be…: Heb. breathe

verses.text_plain: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
verses.verse_html: 21Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

tokens.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept
neither let me give flattering titles

verses.text_plain: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
verses.verse_html: 22For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
